column4: Can somebody help me pleas?  I Just installed a game called Dofus.  It was a exe file and I unziped it onto my computer.  Now I dont know how to "Install" it or play it
Dofus_v1_19_0.zip is what the thing is called thats on my desktop now
you should understand, ubuntu is not windows, you cannot directly use windows applications, or windows games on it... wine MIGHT be able to run those for you tho
if it's a .exe file, it's NOT for linux
and what files did you get OUT of it?
dofus homepage says you extract it to any folder, and then you should have some executable file in there
open the folder you extracted to with the file browser/whatever, and try locating it
i'm just new to this stuff
what part of the detailed instructions escapes you?

the instructions say: extract the .zip, open up a terminal, type cd directory-you-extracted-to, type chmod 755 el.x86.linux.bin, type ./el.x86.linux.bin, open el.ini in your favorite text editor and change "datadir" to the directory you extracted to
then you aren't doing what I said
you also aren't telling me when you got that error
when i put the first thing in the termanal

I assumed you blindly typed in "cd directory-you-extracted-to" instead of actually READING what I typed and realizing that I meant you type in the folder name you extracted to, instead of "directory-you-extracted-to"
right, ok, I extracted it into Luke. so what do i put?

I've got other things to do right now, either try and figure it out by yourself, it really shouldn't require too much brainpower to figure out what the Desktop/foldername is supposed to be, especially as you should see the name on the desktop.. if you can't manage that, ask someone else, I'm off
